entries.name: Additional Action Options
entries: This book features two new action options for combat that GMs can choose to implement at their table: {@action Reposition|CaChRn} and {@action Throw|CaChRn}. Though these options are designed to be available to all characters, they are particularly useful for Enforcers and can help players reinforce the fantasy of this Roguish Archetype. See page {@homebrew 239|[x]} for the rules detailing these options.

entries.name: Additional Spell Options
entries: This book features {@table Druid Spells|CaChRn|several additional druid spells} that can be chosen by barbarians who select this subclass. See the Spells section on pages 249–254 for details.

subclassFeature.name: Path of Shamanic Wrath
entries: Barbarians who follow the Path of Shamanic Wrath carry a unique presence that is immediately palpable upon meeting them—a primal drive only found among those flawlessly in tune with their surroundings and nature. Though they draw on the same magic as druids, these barbarians command its power with authority rather than as a kindred spirit, relentlessly unleashing its fury upon those who would dare defy them.

subclassFeature.name: Druidic Guardian
entries: At 3rd level, you learn {@language Druidic|CaChRn}, the secret language of druids. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden messages. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Others spot the message's presence with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check but can't decipher it without magic.

In addition, you can use your Wisdom modifier, instead of Dexterity, when calculating your Armor Class. For example, if you're using your Unarmored Defense, you can calculate your AC as 10 + your Constitution modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you choose this path at 3rd level, you learn to tap into the primal energy that fuels druidic magic, granting you the ability to cast spells. See the core rulebooks for the general rules of spellcasting and the druid spell list.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the druid spell list. You learn an additional druid cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Path of Shamanic Wrath Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a spell slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell thunderwave} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell thunderwave} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three 1st-level druid spells of your choice that are on the druid spell list, two of which must not require {@status concentration} or have a casting time of more than 1 minute. The Spells Known column of the Path of Shamanic Wrath Spellcasting table shows when you learn more druid spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must not require {@status concentration} or have a casting time of more than 1 minute, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.
The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can be any spell on the druid spell list.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the druid spells you know with another spell of your choice from the druid spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must not require {@status concentration} or have a casting time of more than 1 minute, unless you're replacing the spell you gained at 3rd, 8th, 14th, or 20th level that was allowed to be any spell on the druid spell list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use any simple or martial weapon as a spellcasting focus for your druid spells.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any druid spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your druid spells, since you learn your spells by drawing on the divine essence of nature itself. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a druid spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Shaman's Rage
entries: While raging, the following rules apply to your spellcasting:

items: You can cast your druid spells, but only if they don't require {@status concentration}. If you are already {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell when you enter your rage, the spell immediately ends.
If your turn ends and you haven't attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then, your rage doesn't end early if you targeted a hostile creature with a spell this turn.

Whenever you {@action cast a spell}, you gain temporary hit points equal to twice the spell's level (0 if the spell is a cantrip); you can also add your Rage Damage bonus to one damage roll of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Lash
entries: At 6th level, you gain a special attack option you can use once on each of your turns. When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can cause a mass of crushing vines to magically extend from your arms in place of one of your attacks. The vines lash out at a target you choose within 30 feet of you.

This special attack is a melee weapon attack with which you are proficient. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you; a Huge or larger creature has advantage on this saving throw. If you are raging when you make this special attack, you can add your Rage Damage bonus to your spell save DC for the Strength saving throw. A friendly creature can choose to be hit by this attack. If it does so, it takes no damage from the vines and automatically fails its saving throw against the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Force of Nature
entries: When you reach 10th level, you learn to harness the brutal power of untamed wilds. Whenever you score a critical hit with your {@subclassFeature Primal Lash|Barbarian|PHB|Shamanic Wrath|CaChRn|6|CaChRn} or a spell attack, or whenever a creature rolls a 1 on its saving throw against a spell you cast that deals damage, that target takes extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus. If you're raging, the target instead takes extra damage equal to twice your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath Casting
entries: By the time you reach 14th level, your druidic magic has become perfectly in tune with your primal fury. You gain the following benefits:

items: Immediately after you enter a rage for the first time in a combat, you can cast one of your druid spells as part of the same bonus action; the spell must have a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action. When you cast a spell in this way, you gain temporary hit points equal to your barbarian level plus twice the spell's level.
While you are raging, your Rage Damage bonus is doubled when calculating the damage for your {@subclassFeature Primal Lash|Barbarian|PHB|Shamanic Wrath|CaChRn|6|CaChRn} or a spell you cast.
When you use your {@subclassFeature Primal Lash|Barbarian|PHB|Shamanic Wrath|CaChRn|6|CaChRn} while raging, you can cause the vines to lash out at a target up to 60 feet away from you, instead of 30.

subclassFeature.name: Enforcer
entries: Contrary to most rogues, enforcers focus their training on a more brash, rough-and-tumble approach—whether they find themselves up close and personal on the battlefield or shaking someone down in a back alley. Often employed as hired muscle or hitmen, these rogues lean on their physical dominance to intimidate and overpower their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with medium armor, as well as {@item battleaxe|PHB|battleaxes}, {@item flail|PHB|flails}, {@item morningstar|PHB|morningstars}, and {@item warhammer|PHB|warhammers}. In addition, medium armor doesn't impose disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks for you if it normally would.

subclassFeature.name: Muscular Menace
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use the bonus action granted by your {@classFeature Cunning Action|Rogue|PHB|2|PHB} to attempt to {@action grapple} a creature, and you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks against any creature you are grappling.

In addition, you learn to combine your tactical precision with devastatingly powerful blows. You can deal your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1|PHB} damage with your unarmed strikes or any melee weapon that doesn't have the {@itemProperty H|PHB|heavy} property. You also gain an additional way to use your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1|PHB}; you don't need advantage on the attack roll to use your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1|PHB} against a creature if the creature is {@condition grappled} and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll. All the other rules for {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1|PHB} still apply to you.

subclassFeature.name: Bouncer's Brawn
entries: Starting at 9th level, you can also use the bonus action granted by your {@classFeature Cunning Action|Rogue|PHB|2|PHB} to attempt to {@action shove} a creature. In addition, you gain proficiency in Strength saving throws; if you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Charisma saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Counter Maneuver
entries: At 13th level, you learn to counter a foe's assault. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack or {@action grapple||grapples} you, you can immediately use your reaction to attempt to {@action grapple} or {@action shove} that creature (your choice). If you use this reaction in response to a creature grappling you and win the contest, you also escape the creature's {@action grapple}.

subclassFeature.name: Skull Cracker
entries: Beginning at 17th level, your most precise and powerful strikes can daze your foes and send them reeling. Once on each of your turns, when you hit a creature that is no more than one size larger than you with a melee weapon attack and have advantage on the attack roll, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus) or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn.

race.name: Nagaran
entries: Your nagaran character shares a number of serpentine characteristics with all other nagaran.

entries.name: Suggested Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Dexterity or Constitution score increases by 1 (your choice).

entries.name: Age
entries: Nagaran have an exceptionally long lifespan, blessed by the immortal nature of their naga ancestors. Nagaran reach adulthood around 12 years of age and can live for over 500 years.

entries.name: Common Alignment
entries: Nagaran span the entire spectrum of alignments, with slight predispositions based on their ancestry: {@race Nagaran (Guardian)|CaChRn|guardian nagaran} tend toward law and good, those of {@race Nagaran (Water)|CaChRn|water naga} descent have a neutral bent, and {@race Nagaran (Spirit)|CaChRn|spirit nagaran} are inclined toward evil and chaos.

entries.name: Size
entries: Nagaran can stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and have a tail that stretches another 5 to 10 feet when fully uncoiled. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Ophidian Strikes
entries: Your venomous bite and constricting tail are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit, your bite deals piercing damage equal to 1 + your Strength modifier plus an extra {@damage 1d4} poison damage, and your tail deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

In addition, whenever you attempt to {@action grapple} a creature, you can choose to do so with your tail, leaving your hands free to use as normal. While grappling a creature with your tail, your walking speed is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Poison Resilience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

entries.name: Rejuvenatory Spirit
entries: If a spell, such as {@spell raise dead}, has the sole effect of restoring you to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on you. Once you benefit from this trait, you can't do so again until 7 days have passed.

entries.name: Shed Skin
entries: While you are {@condition grappled}, {@condition restrained}, or otherwise physically bound (such as by {@item manacles|PHB}), you can use your action to automatically escape. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Suggested Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Serpentine|CaChRn}.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: There are three kinds of nagaran: {@race Nagaran (Guardian)|CaChRn|guardian}, {@race Nagaran (Spirit)|CaChRn|spirit}, and {@race Nagaran (Water)|CaChRn|water}. Choose one of these subraces.

subrace.name: Guardian
entries: Whether it be their friends, family, home, or possessions, guardian nagaran are protective to a fault and will stop at nothing to secure and defend that which they value most.

entries.name: Suggested Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2.

entries.name: Guardian's Inheritance
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip and can cast it with no material components. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell cure wounds} once with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell calm emotions} once with this trait. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your suggested spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Suggested Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Celestial|CaChRn}.

subrace.name: Spirit
entries: Spirit nagaran are notoriously tenacious. If left to their own devices, they prefer to outsmart their foes and defeat them with exceptional strategy rather than combat.

entries.name: Suggested Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2.

entries.name: Spirit's Inheritance
entries: You know the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell charm person} once with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell detect thoughts} once with this trait. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your suggested spellcasting ability for these spells, and they require no material components when you cast them using this trait.

entries.name: Suggested Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Abyssal|CaChRn}.

subrace.name: Water
entries: The pragmatic water nagaran pride themselves on sustaining a life of self-sufficiency, unclouded by bias. They rarely seek to maintain long term, intimate relationships.

entries.name: Suggested Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Water's Inheritance
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell expeditious retreat} once with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell invisibility} once with this trait, requiring no material components. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your suggested spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Suggested Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Primordial|CaChRn|Aquan}.

raceFluff.name: Nagaran
entries: {@font Nagaran|serpentine}

Nagaran are an intelligent serpentine race originally created by nagas and infused with their essence as a show of nagan superiority over other reptilian races and their respective kin. All nagaran possess a long, snakelike body and a flared hood: an expanded neck, which they can exaggerate further in a menacing display of power.

entries.name: Ancestors' Legacy
entries: Nagaran embrace many qualities from their creators, but they eschew some others. They are naturally proficient with magic, much more so than other serpentfolk, and they possess a sliver of their forebears' immortality, but they are overall much more amicable in their dealings with other races—a courtesy that is often not returned.

entries.name: Vain Origins
entries: Nagas are known to be overconfident and distrusting of other beings, leading them to rule their domains with absolute authority. Their ubiquitous vainglory inspired them to create a subordinate race of creatures to populate and defend their lairs: one nevertheless superior to other humanoids in their eyes.

The immortal nagas patiently groomed various species of cobras over the course of hundreds of years, slowly infusing them with their magic as time passed. When they were satisfied with the monstrous, magical serpents they had created, the nagas performed an ancient ritual (some say of their own design, some say passed down by another long-forgotten race), infusing the snakes with a precise concoction of their blood and venom.

The newly awakened snakes hissed, and spoke, and obediently served the nagas for decades, but it wasn't long before some ventured forth from their overbearing masters' lairs. The guardian nagaran were the first to depart—their creators being the most benevolent—but shortly thereafter, the water nagaran's longing for independence and the spirit nagaran's desire to escape their brutal tyrants also drove them to new lands to establish a life of their own.

entries.name: Nagaran Names
entries: Nagaran employ a unique naming system wherein the tongue of their naga ancestors is intermixed with the natural hisses and sounds from their cobra roots.

items.name: Female Names:
items.entry: Altha, Diron, Esteca, Kilha, Leta, Milasi, Miya, Rautant, Roga, Tiyanga, Venine, Vipra, Ylan

items.name: Male Names:
items.entry: Bathan, Daron, Gnish, Kig, Kulez, Limek, Nakh, Noko, Rafsa, Sig, Skaln, Tuntun, Zalo

spell.name: Aldricor's Elemental Rebuke

time.condition: which you take when you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

entries: You manipulate some of the incoming elemental energy, harnessing its power in your hand. The damage you take from the triggering attack or effect is cut in half. You can then hurl the energy back at the creature that damaged you if it is within 60 feet of you. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d8} damage of the triggering type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Anti-Blight
entries: This spell fortifies and revitalizes the land in a specific area. There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 300-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown, are immune to all damage, and are imbued with limited sentience and animation. These effects last for 8 hours. For the duration, the area is {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and a hostile creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a plant affected by this spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the overgrowth. A creature {@condition restrained} by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, freeing itself on a success.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you bless the land with natural divinity. The ground in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range becomes consecrated, reviving any normal plants that have died, withered, or rotted within the last 30 days in the area, and causing all plants in the area to become hearty and healthy, bearing fruit, blossoming flowers, and growing vegetables in accordance with their natures. In addition, for the next 48 hours, {@spell blight} spells and other necromancy spells of 3rd level or lower that would deal damage in the area automatically fail, and creatures with the plant type are immune to necrotic damage and have advantage on all ability checks and saving throws while within the area.

spell.name: Antimorph
entries: You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to be flooded with energy that is debilitating to transmutation magic and similar effects. The target must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. Unless the saving throw succeeds by 5 or more, you learn if the target is a shapechanger, in a beast shape, under the effects of a transmutation spell of 4th level or lower, or otherwise having its form altered by a similar effect.

On a failed save, the target is forced to return to its normal form if its form is being altered. Until the spell ends, the target's form can't be altered—willingly or unwillingly—by any spell or effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature or object for each slot level above 4th. Unless the target's saving throw succeeds by 5 or more, you learn if it is under the effects of a transmutation spell of a level equal to the spell slot used to cast this spell or lower.

spell.name: Elongate
entries: You touch a creature, causing its bones and limbs to become unnaturally elastic. For the duration, the target's reach is 5 feet greater than normal when it makes a melee attack on its turn. The target can also touch, pick up, or otherwise interact with objects and surfaces up to 5 feet farther away from itself than normal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the target's reach and the distance to which it can interact with objects and surfaces increases by an additional 5 feet for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Pillar of Earth
entries: You cause a pillar of stone, crystal, or petrified wood to burst from a 5-foot square on a surface that you can see within range (such as the ground, a wall, or a ceiling). The pillar extends perpendicularly up to 30 feet away from the targeted surface, and you can target a surface under a creature or object if it is Medium or smaller. If the pillar is created under a creature, that creature can choose to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space next to the pillar.

As a bonus action, you can touch the pillar to cause it to extend or retract by up to 30 feet (to a maximum of 120 feet). If the pillar is prevented from extending because of a wall, ceiling, or other obstacle, the pillar stops short of the obstacle, and if there is a Medium creature at the end of the pillar, it is considered to be squeezing between the pillar and the obstacle. The pillar has ample handholds (such as small rocks, grooves, or branches), allowing creatures to climb or crawl along it without needing to make an ability check.

The pillar has AC 15 and 30 hit points, and it is immune to poison and psychic damage. If the pillar is reduced to 0 hit points, the spell ends early. When the spell ends, the pillar retracts back to its original surface, along with any creatures on it, and then vanishes.

spell.name: Soaring Vines
entries: Vines magically sprout from plants or a solid surface (such as the ground or a wall) within 30 feet of you and wrap themselves securely around your torso, leaving your arms and legs unhindered. The vines shift with you, growing and retracting as you move from plant to plant or along the ground or other surface.

For the duration, if any of the vines are destroyed, they are immediately and seamlessly replaced by more vines. As long as you are within 30 feet of plants or a solid surface, you have a flying speed of 40 feet, which can't be reduced by nonmagical means. In addition, you can't be knocked {@condition prone}, and you have advantage on saving throws against effects that would move you against your will. When the spell ends, the vines gently pull you back to the nearest plants or solid surface if you are still aloft.

spell.name: Speak with Stone
entries: Choose a stone object or surface within 30 feet of you that is no larger than a 30-foot cube. You imbue the target with limited sentience and animation, giving it the ability to communicate with you. You can question the stone about events that occurred within 60 feet of it within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.

When you cast the spell, you can also turn {@quickref difficult terrain||3} caused by earth or stone within range into ordinary terrain, which lasts for the duration. Or you can turn ordinary terrain where earth or stone are present within range into {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, which lasts for the duration, causing fissures and unstable ground to hinder pursuers, for example.

For the duration, you can speak and understand {@language Primordial|CaChRn|Terran}. This spell also makes you aware of any creatures within range that are merged with stone by the {@spell meld into stone} spell; at your command, you can cause the stone to harmlessly expel such a creature, ending that spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the size of the object or surface you can target and the amount of time into the past you can ask questions regarding increases, as shown in the table below.

spell.name: Spirit Vial

m.text: an empty vial worth at least 1 gp

entries: You draw magical essence into the vial used in the casting of this spell, creating a replenishing pool of either positive or negative energy within the vial (your choice when you cast the spell). Until the spell ends, you can use an action to change the pool from positive to negative energy, or vice versa. If you let go of the vial, the pool vanishes until you are holding the vial again.

For the duration, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to splash some of the vial's contents onto a creature within 5 feet of you. If the target is unwilling, make a melee spell attack against it, affecting the target on a hit. An affected target experiences the following effect, depending on the pool's type of energy:

items.name: Positive
items.entry: The creature gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

items.name: Negative
items.entry: The creature takes necrotic damage equal to {@damage 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entries: When the spell ends, any remaining temporary hit points a target has from this spell are lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hit points and necrotic damage increase by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Tornado
entries: A whirling tornado erupts, filling a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Any creature that starts its turn within the tornado must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet away and 40 feet up. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

As a bonus action, you can move the tornado up to 30 feet in any direction. Any ranged weapon attack against a target within 20 feet of the tornado has disadvantage, and any ranged attack that passes through it automatically misses.

spell.name: Voltaic Surge
entries: You unleash a burst of electrical energy around yourself, causing lightning to arc toward each creature of your choice within range. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Residual electricity then continues crackling around you until the end of your next turn. The next time a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack before then, that creature takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage, can't make any more attacks for the rest of the turn, and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. The residual electricity then fades.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wing Blade

m.text: a melee weapon that lacks the {@itemProperty H|PHB|heavy} property worth at least 1 sp

entries: You weave elemental air into the weapon used in the spell's casting, causing a mystical wing to trail from it. Until the spell ends, your attacks with the weapon deal an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage on a hit, and it has the {@itemProperty F|PHB|finesse} and {@itemProperty T|PHB|thrown} properties (range 20/60) for you. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with the weapon, you can immediately fly up to 15 feet without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}. Doing so doesn't expend any of your movement, but you can't fly in this way if your speed is 0.

For the duration, if you aren't holding the weapon (for example, if you threw it), you can use a bonus action to cause the weapon to fly back to your hand, as long as the weapon is within 120 feet of you.

item.name: Demolition (Common)
entries: Immediately after you hit an object that isn't being worn or carried using the hammer that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to destabilize the object. The rune's activation fails if the object is magical or if it's too large. The maximum size of object the rune's magic can affect is Tiny. After 1 minute, the affected object is magically disintegrated, reducing it to a pile of fine gray dust.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Demolition (Rare)
entries: Immediately after you hit an object that isn't being worn or carried using the hammer that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to destabilize the object. The rune's activation fails if the object is magical or if it's too large. The maximum size of object the rune's magic can affect is Medium. After 1 minute, the affected object is magically disintegrated, reducing it to a pile of fine gray dust.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Demolition (Uncommon)
entries: Immediately after you hit an object that isn't being worn or carried using the hammer that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to destabilize the object. The rune's activation fails if the object is magical or if it's too large. The maximum size of object the rune's magic can affect is Small. After 1 minute, the affected object is magically disintegrated, reducing it to a pile of fine gray dust.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Demolition (Very Rare)
entries: Immediately after you hit an object that isn't being worn or carried using the hammer that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to destabilize the object. The rune's activation fails if the object is magical or if it's too large. The maximum size of object the rune's magic can affect is Huge. After 1 minute, the affected object is magically disintegrated, reducing it to a pile of fine gray dust.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Detonate
entries: While holding the focus that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as an action to infuse a creature within 60 feet of you with unstable arcane energy. If the target is unwilling, it can make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw to avoid the effect. After 1 minute, or when the target drops to 0 hit points, the energy explodes. Each creature within 30 feet of the target must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target has 0 hit points after the explosion, its body is destroyed.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Engage
entries: While wearing the armor that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as an action to bring a target within 60 feet of you into the fray. At the start of your next turn, the target is teleported to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of you; if the target is unwilling, it can make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw, resisting this effect on a success.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Frost
entries: Whenever you deal cold damage to a creature while holding the object that bears this rune, you can activate the rune (no action required) to cause creeping frost to begin covering the target. At the start of each of the target's turns for the next minute, its speed is reduced by 10 feet; this effect can't reduce a creature's speed below 10 feet.

At the end of each of the target's turns for the duration, it can make make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect early on a success. When the effect ends, the target's speed returns to normal.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Recover
entries: While holding the focus that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to infuse a creature within 60 feet of you with a seed of vitality for 1 minute. For the duration, the target regains 5 hit points at the start of each of its turns. When this effect ends, the creature regains an additional 15 hit points.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Return (Rare)
entries: While wearing the belt that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to place a dimensional anchor in your current space. As a bonus action within the next hour, you can teleport back to the anchored space, provided you're on the same plane of existence; the effect doesn't end when you use this bonus action, allowing you to use it an unlimited number of times for the duration.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Return (Uncommon)
entries: While wearing the belt that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to place a dimensional anchor in your current space. As a bonus action within the next minute, you can teleport back to the anchored space, provided you're on the same plane of existence; the effect then ends.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Snap
entries: While wearing the footwear that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action and choose a space you can see within 60 feet of you. At the start of your next turn, you teleport to that space, or the nearest unoccupied space if it is occupied.

item.name: Tick
entries: While holding the object that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as an action to cast {@spell delayed blast fireball}. When cast in this way, the bead instead appears as an hourglass that emits a loud ticking sound every second, and it doesn't explode unless your {@status concentration} ends. Additionally, if at the end of your turn the bead has not yet detonated, the damage increases by {@damage 2d6}, instead of {@damage 1d6}.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

customProperties.trans: bit of clockwork, such as a gear or spring

item.name: Vampiric
entries: While wearing the backwear that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to bind a creature's life force to your own. At the start of your next turn, you regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt to that creature since you activated the rune.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Venom
entries: When you deal piercing damage to a creature with the object that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to inject a slow-acting venom into the target's body. After 1 hour, the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d10} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.

customProperties.trans: weapon that deals piercing damage or other object with a sharp point, such as a needle

itemGroup.name: Demolition
entries: Immediately after you hit an object that isn't being worn or carried using the hammer that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to destabilize the object. The rune's activation fails if the object is magical or if it's too large. The maximum size of object the rune's magic can affect is based on the rune's rarity: Tiny (common), Small (uncommon), Medium (rare), or Huge (very rare). After 1 minute, the affected object is magically disintegrated, reducing it to a pile of fine gray dust.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.
items: Demolition (Common)|CaChRn
Demolition (Uncommon)|CaChRn
Demolition (Rare)|CaChRn
Demolition (Very Rare)|CaChRn

itemGroup.name: Return
entries: While wearing the belt that bears this rune, you can activate the rune as a bonus action to place a dimensional anchor in your current space. As a bonus action within the next minute, you can teleport back to the anchored space, provided you're on the same plane of existence; the effect then ends. If this rune is of rare rarity, the effect lasts for 1 hour and doesn't end when you use this bonus action, allowing you to use it an unlimited number of times for the duration.
Once activated, this rune can't be used again until the next dawn.
items: Return (Uncommon)|CaChRn
Return (Rare)|CaChRn

language.name: Serpentine
entries: {@font SERPENTINE|serpentine}

Though Serpentine's origins are markedly more recent than those of {@language Draconic|CaChRn} itself, it is believed that the dialect was formalized by prominent serpentine creatures— such as elder behirs and dracolisks—in direct revolt of the great wyrms who lorded their magic, wealth, and power over their kin. Similar to {@language Draconic|CaChRn}, this dialects disenchanted creators invented it to communicate away from the prying ears of their tyrannical overlords.

Though Serpentine shares much in common with its predecessor, its script is deliberately challenging for draconic creatures to write, and its speakers similarly prefer words that are challenging for dragons to pronounce.

entries.name: Viperous Convictions
entries: In defiance of {@language Draconic|CaChRn} norms, Serpentine runes are able to be quickly activated by all who wield them. Instead, the requisite time to enact the rune's magic manifests as a delayed release, either over time or all at once.

entries.name: Serpentine Runes
entries: The following runes are presented in alphabetical order. As with other magic items, a rune's description gives its name, its category (including which language it belongs to), its rarity, and its magical properties; it also indicates what type of object(s) the rune can be transferred to.

entries.name: Special Features
entries: Similar to its predecessor ({@language Draconic|CaChRn}), Serpentine numbers are visibly distinguished from letters by a small curved mark below the symbol.

The behir is a serpentine monster that can slither like a snake or use its dozen legs to move with considerable speed. A behir is about 40 feet long and weighs about 4,000 pounds. The coloration of behirs ranges from ultramarine to deep blue with bands of gray-brown.

{@font The behir is a serpentine monster that can slither like a snake or use its dozen legs to move with considerable speed. A behir is about 40 feet long and weighs about 4,000 pounds. The coloration of behirs ranges from ultramarine to deep blue with bands of gray-brown.|serpentine}
My in-laws said, "Mr. Smith's 7 cats & dogs are the best ever!"
{@font My in-laws said, "Mr. Smith's 7 cats & dogs are the best ever!"|serpentine}
{@font 43 + 981 = 1,024|serpentine}

table.name: Druid Spells
rows: {@spell soaring vines|CaChRn}, {@spell speak with stone|CaChRn},* {@spell wing blade|CaChRn}, {@spell spirit vial|CaChRn}
footnotes: * Can be learned by {@class Barbarian|PHB|Path of Shamanic Wrath|Shamanic Wrath|CaChRn} Barbarians

action.name: Reposition
entries: While {@action grapple||grappling} a creature, you can make a special melee attack to attempt to pull it to another nearby space. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this attack replaces one of them.

You make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (the target chooses the ability to use). If you win the contest, you can move the target to another unoccupied space of your choice that is within your reach.

action.name: Throw
entries: While {@action grapple||grappling} a creature, you can make a special melee attack to attempt to throw it. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this attack replaces one of them.

You make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (the target chooses the ability to use). If the target is your size or larger, you make this check with disadvantage.

If you win the contest, you can throw the target horizontally a number of feet up to 5 × your Strength modifier (minimum of 5 feet), or half as far if you throw the target vertically. If the target fails the contest by 5 or more, it falls {@condition prone} at the end of the throw. Whether you win or lose the contest, your {@action grapple} ends on the target after attempting to throw it.

data.name: Placeholder
entries: {@note At this time this source has been only partially converted. The available material is listed below:}

items: {@race Nagaran|CaChRn} and subraces thereof

{@class Rogue|PHB|Enforcer|Enforcer|CaChRn}
{@action Reposition|CaChRn}
{@action Throw|CaChRn}
{@language Serpentine|CaChRn} and runes thereof
